ratings.question_text: What is your overall assessment of this course?

narratives.question_text: How would you summarize AFAM 505 01/AMST 643 01 for a fellow student? Would you recommend AFAM 505 01/AMST 643 01 to another student? Why or why not?
comments: Absolutely. Financial crises courses in other schools should really emphasize the issues and informational frictions that are central to this class, and I surprised that they do not. I would advise any student interested in intermediation or business cycle theory to take the course.

narratives.question_text: How did this course deepen your knowledge of your discipline/profession? To what extent did this course contribute to your dissertation/research?
comments: This course not only tells you what "money" is, but how subtle and pervasive it is to understanding what crises are as well as understanding business cycles. Now when I read papers on banking, I have a more discerning eye about what key informational frictions they might be ignoring, and how they define crises.
